io.multimap

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.multimap.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Map
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    This class implements a 1:n key-value store where each key is associated with a list of values.
    For more information please visit the C++ Reference for class Map.
    Since:
    0.3.0
    Author:
    Martin Trenkmann

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Map.Limits
      This type provides static methods for obtaining system limitations.
      static class  Map.Options
      This class is a pure data holder used for configuring instances of type Map.
      static class  Map.Stats
      This type is a pure data holder for reporting statistical information.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(Path directory)
    throws Exception
        Opens an already existing map located in directory.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        • the directory does not contain a map

      • Map

        public Map(String directory)
    throws Exception
        Same as before, but taking directory as string.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • Map

        public Map(Path directory,
   Map.Options options)
    throws Exception
        Opens or creates a map in directory. For the latter, you need to set options.createIfMissing(true). If an error should be raised in case the map already exists, set options.setErrorIfExists(true). When a new map is created other fields in options are used to configure the map's block size and number of partitions. See Map.Options for more information.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        when options.isCreateIfMissing() is false (which is the default)
        • the directory does not contain a map
        when options.isCreateIfMissing() return true and no map exists
        • options.getBlockSize() is zero
        • options.getBlockSize() is not a power of two
        when options.isErrorIfExists() is true
        • the directory already contains a map

      • Map

        public Map(String directory,
   Map.Options options)
    throws Exception
        Same as before, but taking directory as string.
        Throws:
        Exception

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(byte[] key,
       byte[] value)
         throws Exception
        Appends value to the end of the list associated with the specified key.

        Acquires:

        • a writer lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • key.size() > Map.Limits.maxKeySize()
        • value.size() > Map.Limits.maxValueSize()
        • the map was opened in read-only mode

      • put

        public void put(String key,
       byte[] value)
         throws Exception
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Throws:
        Exception
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • get

        public Iterator get(byte[] key)
        Returns a read-only iterator for the list associated with the specified key. If the key does not exist, an empty iterator that has no values is returned. A non-empty iterator owns a reader lock on the associated list and must be closed via Iterator.close() when it is not needed anymore. Not closing iterators leads to deadlocks sooner or later.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a reader lock on the list associated with key.

      • get

        public Iterator get(String key)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:
        0.4.0

        public boolean contains(byte[] key)
        Returns true if there is at least one value associated with the specified key, false otherwise.

        Since:

        public int remove(byte[] key)
        Removes all values from the list associated with the specified key.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.

        Returns:
        the number values that have been removed.

      • removeFirstMatch

        public boolean removeFirstMatch(byte[] key,
                       Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Removes the first value for which predicate yields true from the list associated with the specified key. The predicate can be any callable that implements the Callables.Predicate interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any value has been removed, false otherwise.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • removeFirstMatch

        public boolean removeFirstMatch(String key,
                       Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • removeFirstMatch

        public int removeFirstMatch(Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Removes all values from the list associated with the first key for which predicate yields true. The predicate can be any callable that implements the Callables.Predicate interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on lists associated with matching keys.
        Returns:
        the number of values that have been removed.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • removeAllMatches

        public int removeAllMatches(byte[] key,
                   Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Removes the first value for which predicate yields true from the list associated with the specified key. The predicate can be any callable that implements the Callables.Predicate interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        the number of values that have been removed.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • removeAllMatches

        public int removeAllMatches(String key,
                   Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • removeAllMatches

        public Utils.Pair<Integer,Long> removeAllMatches(Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Removes all values from lists associated with keys for which predicate yields true. The predicate can be any callable that implements the Callables.Predicate interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on lists associated with matching keys.
        Returns:
        a pair whose first element tells the number of keys and the second element the total number of values that have been removed.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • replaceFirstEqual

        public boolean replaceFirstEqual(byte[] key,
                        byte[] oldValue,
                        byte[] newValue)
        Replaces the first value which is equal to oldValue with newValue in the list associated with the specified key.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Hence, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any value has been replaced, false otherwise.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • replaceFirstEqual

        public boolean replaceFirstEqual(String key,
                        byte[] oldValue,
                        byte[] newValue)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • replaceAllEqual

        public int replaceAllEqual(byte[] key,
                  byte[] oldValue,
                  byte[] newValue)
        Replaces all values which are equal to oldValue with newValue in the list associated with the specified key.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Hence, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        the number of values that have been replaced.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • replaceAllEqual

        public int replaceAllEqual(String key,
                  byte[] oldValue,
                  byte[] newValue)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:

      • replaceFirstMatch

        public boolean replaceFirstMatch(byte[] key,
                        Callables.Function map)
        Replaces the first value with the result of invoking map in the list associated with the specified key. A match is indicated by returning a byte array, not null, from map for a given value. The map function can be any callable that implements the Callables.Function interface.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Hence, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any value has been replaced, false otherwise.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • replaceFirstMatch

        public boolean replaceFirstMatch(String key,
                        Callables.Function map)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • replaceAllMatches

        public int replaceAllMatches(byte[] key,
                    Callables.Function map)
        Replaces all values with the result of invoking map in the list associated with the specified key. A match is indicated by returning a byte array, not null, from map for a given value. The map function can be any callable that implements the Callables.Function interface.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Hence, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        the number of values that have been replaced.
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • replaceAllMatches

        public int replaceAllMatches(String key,
                    Callables.Function map)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • forEachKey

        public void forEachKey(Callables.Procedure process)
        Applies process to each key in the map. The process object can be any callable that implements the Callables.Procedure interface.

        Acquires a reader lock on the map object.

      • forEachValue

        public void forEachValue(byte[] key,
                Callables.Procedure process)
        Applies process to each value in the list associated with the specified key. The process object can be any callable that implements the Callables.Procedure interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.

      • forEachValue

        public void forEachValue(String key,
                Callables.Procedure process)
        Same as before, but taking key as string instead of byte array. Internally the key is converted into a byte array via Utils.toByteArray(String).
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • getStats

        public Map.Stats getStats()
        Returns statistical information about the map. Be aware that this operation requires to visit each key-list entry of the map. Extensive use will slow down your application.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a reader lock on the list that is currently visited.
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns true if the map is read-only, false otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
        Flushes all data to disk and ensures that the map is stored in consistent state. This method must be called when an application shuts down in order to avoid data loss.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • stats

        public static Map.Stats stats(Path directory)
                       throws Exception
        Returns statistical information about each partition of the map located in directory. This method is similar to getStats() except that the map does not need to be instantiated.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        • the directory does not contain a map
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • importFromBase64

        public static void importFromBase64(Path directory,
                    Path input)
                             throws Exception
        Imports key-value pairs from an input file or directory into the map located in directory. If input refers to a directory all files in that directory will be imported, except hidden files starting with a dot and other sub-directories. A description of the file format can be found in the overview section on the project's website.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if the constructor of Map fails or if the input file or directory cannot be read.

      • importFromBase64

        public static void importFromBase64(Path directory,
                    Path input,
                    Map.Options options)
                             throws Exception
        Same as before, but gives the user more control by providing an Map.Options parameter which is passed to the constructor of Map when opening. This way a map can be created if it does not already exist.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • exportToBase64

        public static void exportToBase64(Path directory,
                  Path output)
                           throws Exception
        Exports all key-value pairs from the map located in directory to a file denoted by output. If the file already exists, its content will be overwritten. The generated file is in canonical form as described in the overview section on the project's website.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        • the directory does not contain a map
        • the creation of the output file failed

      • exportToBase64

        public static void exportToBase64(Path directory,
                  Path output,
                  Map.Options options)
                           throws Exception
        Same as before, but gives the user more control by providing an Map.Options parameter. Most users will use this to pass a compare function that triggers a sorting of all lists before exporting them.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • optimize

        public static void optimize(Path directory,
            Path output)
                     throws Exception
        Rewrites the map located in directory to the directory denoted by output performing various optimizations. For more details please refer to the overview section on the project's website.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        • the directory does not contain a map
        • the creation of a new map in output failed

      • optimize

        public static void optimize(Path directory,
            Path output,
            Map.Options options)
                     throws Exception
        Same as before, but gives the user more control by providing an Map.Options parameter. Most users will use this to pass a compare function that triggers a sorting of all lists.
        Throws:
        Exception
